LABEL: electrooculogram procedure
definition: An electrophysiologic test that measures the existing resting electrical potential between the cornea and Bruch's membrane. The most common use of the electrooculogram is to confirm disease.

LABEL: cardiac auscultation
definition: Investigation of heart sounds with a stethoscope.

LABEL: duplex ultrasound with color flow imaging
definition: A form of Doppler ultrasound examination that examines blood vessels and blood flow.

LABEL: cardiac catheterization
definition: A procedure in which a catheter (thin hollow tube) is threaded into the heart via a large blood vessel, generally with contrast dye being injected through the catheter to visualize the heart chambers and coronary arteries.
Leigh comment: There is arterial catheter placement already present in MAXO. Wondering what other terms need to be added to make a full branch

LABEL: oncologist evaluation
definition: Assessment by a specialist who has expertise in cancer management.
Leigh comment: this exists as medical oncologist evaluation

LABEL: diffusion weighted cerebral MRI
definition: A type of cerebral magnetic resonance (MR) imaging that measures random Brownian motion of water molecules within each voxel of imaged brain tissue.

LABEL: immune cell function assay
definition: Measurement of peripheral blood lymphocyte response following stimulation to assess the degree of functionality of the cell-mediated immune response. A variety of tests exist to measure intracellular ATP levels, proliferation, and other functional responses.
Peter comment: I think this could go under clinical laboratory procedure, but with time we might want to have a branch such as cell function assay -- platelet aggregation would be another example.
Leigh comment: Need cell function assay pattern

LABEL: platelet transmission electron microscopy
definition: A type of electron microscopy in which a beam of electrons is transmitted through a thin section in order to visualize the internal structures of platelets.
Leigh comment: suggestion to make electron microscopy a parent procedure, but this doesn't exist yet

LABEL: protein glycosylation assay
definition: Assessment of the degree or kind of protein glycosylation (covalent attachment of a carbohydrate moiety to a protein).
Leigh comment: maybe have a protein modification measurement grouping?, same request as 505

LABEL: hepatobiliary iminodiacetic acid scan
definition: An imaging procedure in which a radioactive tracer is injected intravenously. The tracer is taken up by bile producing cells and subsequently travels with the bile into the gallbladder and through the bile ducts to the small intestine. The hepatobiliary iminodiacetic acid (HIDA) scan can be used to visualize the liver, gallbladder and bile ducts.
Leigh comment: This is the same request as MAXO:0035090 cholescintigraphy #447, though cholescintigraphy was the label previously. We decided hepatobiliary iminodiacetic acid scan was the best label previously. Which ID would youlike to use? MAXO:0035111 or MAXO:0035090?

LABEL: gustatory testing
definition: A medical test that evaluates the ability to taste. The tests are either chemical or electrical in nature. Chemical testing uses the natural stimuli and chemical tastants (sweet, sour, salty, bitter, and umami) to assess taste, whereas electrical testing adopts electrical currents applied directly to the surface of the tongue. Other investigations are employed in the assessment of gustatory dysfunction, such as certain imaging techniques, though these are not as useful in quantifying taste disorders. PMID:33620811
Leigh comment: not sure where in hierarchy

LABEL: immune complex assay
definition: An assay to assess the presence of immune complexes in the blood circulation.
Peter comment: (Note there are many different technologies but we do not need to model this level of detail for now)

LABEL: sweat electrolyte test
definition: A quantitative measurement of the amount of an electrolyte present in sweat.
Leigh comment: Note: def of electrolyte assessment needs to change to bodily fluid

LABEL: paracentesis
definition: A procedure that removes peritoneal fluid from the abdomen (peritoneal cavity) through a needle or catheter to obtain ascitic fluid for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes.
Leigh comment: amniocentesis, pericardiocentesis, thorancentesis all are terms to be added.

LABEL: salivary cortisol test
definition: A determination of the amount of protein present in blood
Leigh comment: Note: need to make salivary protein pattern (I think). Also, rework protein measurement in blood.

LABEL: motor evoked potential evaluation
definition: A neurophysiological examination that monitors the corticospinal tract beginning with a stimulus at the motor cortex, which travels along the corticospinal tract of the spinal cord to the nerve root, and then the peripheral nerve before terminating in a muscle belly. PMID:35593855
Leigh comment: Note: need neurophysiological examination

LABEL: refraction test
definition: A vision test that determines the presence of myopia, hyperopia, or astigmatism.

LABEL: water deprivation test
definition: The water deprivation test, also known as the indirect water deprivation test should potentially be able to distinguish the various forms of DI. Deprivation of water intake should allow patients with primary polydipsia to concentrate their urine while those with central or nephrogenic DI continue to excrete dilute urine. Administration of desmopressin (Deamino-8-D-arginine vasopressin), the synthetic analog of AVP, after water deprivation should help with differentiating patients with central DI from those with nephrogenic DI as the former should be able to concentrate the urine once the deficient action of AVP is replaced with desmopressin, while the latter should not show a significant response due to end-organ resistance to the action of AVP or its analogs. PMID:30779536
Leigh comment: need to add diagnostic procedure of kidney and move kidney function testing there.

LABEL: phrenic nerve stimulation test
definition: A test that applied electric or magnetic stimulation to the neck to measure the response of the phrenic nerve.

LABEL: electroretinogram procedure
definition: The electroretinogram (ERG) is a diagnostic test that measures the electrical activity of the retina in response to a light stimulus.

LABEL: breath hydrogen test
definition: The hydrogen breath test is a noninvasive procedure to diagnose dietary intolerance (e.g., lactose or galactose intolerance) and related conditions by measuring the amount of hydrogen exhaled in the breath following ingestion of the relevant sugar.
Leigh comment: need breath test, pulmonary function breath test, nitrogen breath test

LABEL: platelet aggregation assay
definition: An assessment of how well platelets aggregate (clump together) in the process of blood clotting.
Leigh comment: Need cell function assay pattern

LABEL: erythrocyte sedimentation rate measurement
definition: A measurement of the speed at which red blood cells in anticoagulated whole blood descend in a standardized tube in one hour. Increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate is a nonspecific sign of inflammation.
Leigh comment: Need cell function assay pattern

LABEL: fractional excretion assessment
definition: kind of renal function test that assesses the proportion of electrolytes that are retained (or excreted) by the kidney (primarily the renal tubule).

LABEL: electromyelography pocedure
definition: Electromyography (EMG) is a diagnostic procedure that evaluates the muscle response to electrical impulses from the nerves that control them, called motor neurons. The test is used to help detect neuromuscular abnormalities. It is usually performed after a nerve conduction study.
Leigh comment: need nerve conduction study

LABEL: fructose tolerance test
definition: Determination of serum uric acid following the administration of an oral bolus of fructose to assess the ability of an individual to digest fructose.
Leigh comment: Need new parent term that includes glucose tolerance test.

LABEL: CT urogram
definition: Computed tomography (CT) examination of the kidneys, ureters and bladder following administration of intravenous contrast material.

LABEL: apoptosis assay
definition: A test to determine if cells are undergoing programmed cell death.
Leigh comment: Need cell function assay pattern

LABEL: neonatologist evaluation
definition: Examination by a doctor who specializes in the care of newborn babies.

LABEL: pulmonary function testing
definition: A complete evaluation of the respiratory system including patient history, physical examinations, and tests of pulmonary function. The primary purpose of pulmonary function testing is to identify the severity of pulmonary impairment.

LABEL: functional T cell assessment
definition: The test measures the T cell responses to antigens of common infections as well as to mitogens, allowing detection of deficiencies in this arm of the immune response.
Leigh comment: Need cell function assay pattern

LABEL: complement assay
definition: A complement test is a blood test that measures the activity of one or more proteins that make up the complement system in blood circulation.

LABEL: natural killer cell function test
definition: An assay of the physiology of natural killer (NK) cells.
Peter comment: For instance, NK cells (or total peripheral blood mononuclear cells) are isolated from whole blood and mixed with fluorescently labeled K562 target cells and the proportion of lysed (killed) K562 cells is determined by flow cytometry.
Leigh comment: Need cell function assay pattern

LABEL: perchlorate discharge test
definition: In the perchlorate discharge test, first radioactive iodine is administered, sufficient time is allowed to pass so that the radioactive iodine is captured by the thyroid, and then, perchlorate is administered orally. The perchlorate displaces non-organified iodide from the thyroid. The perchlorate discharge test is considered positive (abnormal) if there is an abnormally rapid loss of radioactive iodine from the thyroid.
Leigh comment: Need diagnostic procedure of endocrine system|also should be nuclear medicine procedure child

LABEL: somatosensory evoked potential assessment
definition: Measurement of somatosensory evoked potentials (SEPs), which reflect the electrical activity of the brain that results from the stimulation of touch. SEP monitoring may be employed intraoperatively to identify, and ideally, avoid impending permanent damage to neurologic structures. PMID: 31335078

LABEL: dentist evaluation
definition: A procedure where a dental professional who was not previously involved in a patient's treatment, reviews a patient's medical history, examines the patient, and makes recommendations as to care and treatment.

LABEL: electron microscopic study
definition: The transmission electron microscope (TEM) is a diagnostic tool to screen human tissues at high magnification to visualize the ultrastructural level.

LABEL: jerk-locked averaging
definition: A technique that combines EEG and EMG to assess myoclonus; it use electromyography (EMG) electrodes for the arms or legs, and correlates averaged EEG responses with EMG bursts used as a trigger. PMID: 1464676
Leigh comment: Also, change EEG to same parentNote: This paper (table 2)  has numerous new terms to add:https://www.aanem.org/mxonline/resources/downloads/Monograph/30:Electrodiagnostic%20Studies%20of%20Myoclonus.pdf

LABEL: hormone measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of a particular hormone present in a sample.

LABEL: urine hormone measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of a particular hormone present in a sample of urine.
Leigh comment: This could be a pattern in the future

LABEL: nerve conduction study
definition: A test to determine the electrical conduction of the motor and sensory nerves of the human body.
Peter comment: synoynm A nerve conduction velocity test, NCV test
Leigh comment: I think NCV would be child term, but must look more closely

LABEL: reproductive endocrinologist assessment
definition: Reproductive endocrinology and infertility is a surgical subspecialty of obstetrics and gynecology that trains physicians in reproductive medicine addressing hormonal functioning as it pertains to reproduction as well as the issue of infertility.

LABEL: flow cytometry procedure
definition: A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid. NCIT:C16585

LABEL: abdominal paracentesis
definition: A procedure where fluid is removed from the abdomen using a needle.
Leigh comment: Abdominoparacentesis seems predominantly used in dogs. Abdominal paracentesis seems to be used more often.

LABEL: in vitro DNA repair study
definition: A test that measures DNA damage/breakage in patient cells.  DNA damage repair plays an important role in cancer's initiation and progression, and in therapeutic resistance.

LABEL: L-selectin shedding study
definition: This test is used to measure the amount of L-Selectin (CD62L) shed from the surface of neutrophils before and after stimulation of the TLR pathway. The test can help identify patients with defects in their toll-like receptor signalling pathway and can be used to diagnose IRAK-4, MyD88 and UNC93B deficiency. (NHS)

LABEL: blood culture procedure
definition: A laboratory test in which blood, taken from the patient, is inoculated into bottles containing culture media to determine whether infection-causing microorganisms (bacteria or fungi) are present in the patient's bloodstream.

LABEL: hair microscopy
definition: Microscopic examination of the hair (also called hair microscopy) is an inexpensive tool that may aid in the diagnosis of systemic disorders as the appearance, structure, and/or growth of hair are modified in various congenital and acquired diseases. (PMID:34843009)

LABEL: circulating hormone measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of a particular hormone present in a blood sample.
Leigh comment: synonym assessment of circulating hormone

LABEL: blood gas assessment in umbilical cord blood
definition: A test that measures the amount of oxygen, carbon dioxide, and pH in the blood of the umbilical cord.

LABEL: enzyme activity assessment
definition: Measurement of the functionality of an enzyme.

LABEL: circulating immunoglobulin measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of immunoglobulins present in a blood sample.

LABEL: cerebrospinal fluid metabolite measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of metabolites present in a cerebrospinal fluid sample.

LABEL: erythrocyte enzyme activity assessment
definition: Measurement of the functionality of an enzyme derived from erythrocytes.

LABEL: leukocyte enzyme activity assessment
definition: Measurement of the functionality of an enzyme derived from leukocytes.

LABEL: tissue enzyme activity assessment
definition: Measurement of the functionality of an enzyme derived from a particular tissue

LABEL: stool metabolite measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of metabolites present in a stool sample.

LABEL: stool xenobiotic measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of xenobiotics (a chemical foreign to the body) present in a stool sample.

LABEL: tissue metabolite measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of metabolites present in a particular tissue.

LABEL: gastric fluid xenobiotic measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of xenobiotics (a chemical foreign to the body) present in gastric fluid.

LABEL: hair xenobiotic measurement
definition: A quantitative measurement of xenobiotics (a chemical foreign to the body) present in a hair sample.
